website_summaries.verdict: More complicated to hook up than a submersible heater, but offers accurate, steady temperature control.
pros: Owners like the quality of the fittings, and the way this alternative heating unit doesn’t clutter the back of the tank
cons: Owners must purchase separate thermostat to better monitor aquarium temperatures, and a canister filter

customer_reviews.title: No more ugly hardware in your aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: I've used several Hydor heaters in my aquariums over the years and I haven't had a single issue with them. When purchasing heaters it's important to not skimp, especially because a heater malfunction can end up KO'ing all your hard work in your aquarium. This heater has been performing wonderfully so far and I'm very pleased with how consistent it keeps the temperature of my aquarium. It's very easy to secure to your hoses as well, I've had no leaks with just the built in cuffs that clamp onto the hoses. If you are on the fence about getting an in-line heater then pull the trigger, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Got a replacement
customer_reviews.text: Worked well and then about 4 months later it just quit working. Started clicking on and off and was not hearting. Have contacted Hydor customer service and they were excellent. Will be sending me a replacement unit. Currently have a standard heater in the tank to hold me over.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 months but then sensor stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Great heater when it works. It leaves the unsightly hardware near the filter below. However, the temprature sensor or something in it started becoming inaccurate after about 4 months. I noticed this after my other thermometer read 72 instead of 78. I had to turn this heater up to 84 to get it to kick on again. Thankfully its plugged into the thermometer outlet which will feed or cut power to the heater (which was only intended as a safety layer). I'll be super bummed if it gets so inaccurate that it never turns on though.
customer_reviews.author: Dr d

customer_reviews.title: Wildly innacurate temperature swings.
customer_reviews.text: The analog temp dial on the side is not accurate at all, upon setting it to 78 degrees it wouldn't even kick on until the tank was down to 74 degrees. Then I would check on the tank other times and it was up to 82-84 degrees. It's also very large in size and difficult to hide or mount. I replaced with the ISTA unit also available here on Amazon that has the digital temp readout and digital temp setting and it's far more accurate and much smaller and is about the same price as this, besides the name brand this has nothing going for it in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Leak Risk
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for 7 months or so, but a couple days ago I came home to a nearly empty turtle tank. The heater had failed catastrophically, melting a hole through itself and leaking about half the contents of my 75 gal tank onto the floor of my 3rd story apartment. I've spent the last two days pulling up carpeting and trying to dry out the subfloor and underlayment. I will be sticking to in-tank heaters from now on, this thing is a huge potential point of failure and risk. Pictures of the damage are attached.
customer_reviews.author: Revelatus

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked! Customer service hasn't responded.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was amazing while it worked, but two months later it starts clicking like crazy shutting off and turning on rapidly. Read online and saw some people who had the same symptoms and then came home to a tank of cooked fish. I emailed hydor and they just haven't responded. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fairly large physical size
customer_reviews.text: So far the heater has been good. No leaks and it’s quiet. It’s fairly large which made it difficult to install in the cabinet. The instructions say vertical mount only so after adding soft bends for tubing it takes up quite a bit of space. I don’t have it connected to a large tank so it doesn’t work very hard. That might prevent over heating but at one point I accidentally turned it up to 88 degrees. It was able to heat the water but barely turned off. There are no fish yet so no harm done. The star reduction is because of its physical size and not allowing horizontal mounting. UNS 40c (16.9gal) UNS delta 60 canister No lid
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Manasse

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, crap product.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I read the reviews and knew there were people having troubles with this unit and bought it anyways because I really did not want a heater inside my tank. Not to be surprised three weeks later this heater wont function properly. Started off with the clicking on and off all the time and now it won't even turn on if you crank the temp all the way up. Such a nice concept and makes for a much cleaner looking tank, but not to last a month and cost what it does? Do not waste your money on this product as I have.
customer_reviews.author: Gundy

customer_reviews.title: Accurate heater that removes clutter from your tank!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I have ever seen a heater that is so accurate and maintanes the same temperature. I have had this thing running for about two weeks and regardless of what happens in the room my tank is in I never see the temperature fluctuate at all. Like not event by a tenth. Amazingly accurate and removes the eyesore of having a heater in the tank. Well worth the money. Ive heard that the thermostat goes out on these after a while and I will update my review if that happens.
customer_reviews.author: J. Youkhanna

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went inline heater
customer_reviews.text: Have this on my 55 gallon aquarium, with a Eheim classic 600 canister filter. Has held temperature steady. Had to return the Hydor 300 since the Eheim uses a 1/2 inch hose, and the Hydor 300 has 5/8. No problem returning, and was very happy with their service. They should make a Hydor 300 with a 1/2 inch hose in my opinion. Yet the Hydor 200 seems to do the job just fine for a 55 gallon tank. One of those purchases you make and say, great decision, for an aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne C.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months but was replaced
customer_reviews.text: Update: I contacted Hydor about my heater that stopped working and they replaced it. There is a 2 year manufacturer warrant and they honored it. Customer service was 5 star but I’ll leave my review on a 4 since I did have to replace it so early Worked great for 5 months. But it just stopped working. It’ll turn on if I crank it up to 90 degrees but doesn’t register anything under that. I had read many reviews that were split between this thing working great forever or dying after a few months. I assumed a heater this expensive would have a warranty but it doesn’t
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Temp control goes bad within the first year.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the concept. After owning this for 8 months the temp control is off. To keep a 29gallon tank at 75F. I have to turn the temp knob to 82F. I have cleaned the inside with a brush as discussed in the manual. So far no response from hydor in the past 2 weeks when I put in a request for help.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Young

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of not having a heater in the tank. A nice clean look. My sump compartments wouldn't allow for a heater the size I needed. I thought this would be great and it was for almost 2 years. After about a year and a half I had to keep turning it up and thinking maybe it was getting bumped or something. Then when it was at max and just stayed there I knew it needed to be replaced. I couldn't afford for it to fail altogether. So now I have a heater in my tank. Skip this product!!! very nice at first but not for the long term
customer_reviews.author: Brian/Robin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my 60 gallon a few days ago. Ordered the replacement rubber hose connectors for my fluval 206 and then used those to easily add this heater to the return water house. Has been holding temp nicely since installation. Will update if anything changes. Update: it’s been about a year and a half - haven’t had any issues. Water temp is maintained perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Worked really well for 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This heater was great, inline it kept the tank quite stable at 80f. But tonight the wife heard this strange clicking sound. It was the heater clicking on and off very quickly. The tank as at 75f. I can’t trust the thermostat inside the heater. It still heated if I turned it all the way up but it was no longer accurate and I just unplugged it just to be safe. Using my backup eheim heater for now. I have an external heater controller that i’ll try see if it works with this heater turned on high.
customer_reviews.author: Fried

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate thermostat, large and cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: It works, and it keeps me from needing a heater inside the tank, but it's quite large and needs to go between your canister and the return on your tank so keep that in mind. I don't know if it's just my unit or what, but I had it set to 78 degrees and the tank was at 74 (barely above ambient) and it wasn't running. I ended up adding an Inkbird temperature controller and setting the thermostat on the heater to 80-something. The Inkbird got the temp right up to 78 and maintained it there using this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Functioned unreliably & lasted less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product have had this less than a year, paid quite a bit of money for this and it quit working 3 days ago! It’s never kept very accurate temperature always turning off when the water was not at the right temperature. We have been very frustrated with this product. We are definitely not going to reorder this. Was really wanting to like this because I need something external for my large aggressive fish’s tank since he likes to break things - but we will be going with a titanium heater instead of another one of these products.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Mejia

customer_reviews.title: After the failure of my second i'm done with these
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these. they aren't cheap and the idea is sound. While these work they work really well, better than in tank heaters. However both of mine started leaking after 4 months, and the second one I was very careful about, always made sure to turn it off and keep water cycling to cool it down before dismantling my filter, ALWAYS kept it vertical. Just a poor execution of a good idea. I switched to an in-tank titanium heater and if I go inline again I'll buy a jaeger with the inline fitting. Wasted quite a bit of money on these, bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: These are great until they aren’t...
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these on my 125g Oscar tank for 3 years. I loved them - until I woke up one morning to a ruined floor and a $1000 home owners claim because the Hydor provided seal between the filter and the heater began leaking.
customer_reviews.author: IU Fan

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Keeps Temp well
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing. Fits perfectly on my Fluval 406 and Heats up my 55 gallon with no problem at all. Definitely is on longer than the intake heaters but no stupid tube visible in the tank and no cords running from out the tank. Cleaned up my cords and gives more room and a cleaner look in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have had this external 200w heater for roughly 8 months now and is working great. It keeps my 55 gallon tank at a consistent 80F. I use an internal thermometer and the temperature never fluctuates beyond 1 degree. The temperature that is listed on the actual heater may be off by a few degrees, so always use a separate thermometer. I always make sure that water is flowing through it when it's ON. The heater is not small, and I mount mine with zip ties. The hose clamps work well and fit perfectly for my Eheim Classic 2215.
customer_reviews.author: MakeWave

customer_reviews.title: FAILED IN LESS THAN A MONTH
customer_reviews.text: heater will not stay on, instead, the light flashes and the heater clicks on and off quickly. I've had it less than 2 months. Unfortunately, I had to cut my hose to install it, and I cannot remove it without finding a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Justin A

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Works well keeps temperature where set. If running canister filter make sure the hose dimensions are correct. I had to modify my outlet tubes to fit the heater. The heater has a smaller diameter than my filter outlet tube (Marineland 360 ) other than that it is awesome. I don't have to look at the heater in the tank. Update. Since my last review the heater stopped working. Luckily I keep a back up heater just in case something happens. My 5 stars just went to zero. Do not buy this. I am returning it. Waste of 60.00 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. Works perfectly with the Eheim Classic 250 filter's hoses. Rated a 4-star because like pretty much every aquarium heater I've ever had, regardless of the temp you set it you can expect the tank to actually remain steady at 2-4 degrees cooler. I have this set at 90 currently, temp is steady at 88 degrees. For the record, the tank is only 12 gallons... Would recommend, and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Franz

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this heater for our 75 gallon turtle tank. It was set-up in September 2019. I thought it was working, but now I think it was the warmer room that the tank is in. The temp in the tank is never about 66–67 no matter how I set the heater temp. I purchased a new heater from a different manufacture and it is already heating the tank. It is not clear on how to return this product at this point. It has a 1 year warranty and we are 8-9 months in. The manual it comes with requires a magnifying glass to read.
customer_reviews.author: Happyrock

customer_reviews.title: I love this inline heater
customer_reviews.text: I love this inline heater! It is the best thing for a fish tank. I have a 120gal and it took only a day to completely heat it up. I put cichlids in my tank and they adjusted instantly. I use to have a 90 gal tank where I have two submersible heaters they worked, however they took up space in the tank and did not evenly spread out the heat like the inline heater does. This is brilliant for my tank and I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good but huge and does not fit all tubing
customer_reviews.text: Love this so far. Took a while to heat up my new tank but now it is okay. Use it with the external thermostat which has some flaws but does the job. Which it would be not as chunky and the screws to tighten the tubing would work for thicker tubes. Had to hook up mine using clamps because the screw rings of the heater did not fit over the thick tubing even though it was 5/8". Anyway we will see in the long run how it performs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great aquarium heater
customer_reviews.text: In line heaters are much better than immersion heaters for over tank water accuracy and evenness. Hydor products are great. I still use a digital thermometer, though. The markings on the heater ... not very accurate. Still, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Wheelock

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 14 months.
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted, which was only 14 months. Customer service from Hydor, both on their website and on Facebook, was non-existent. My attempts to get service or a warranty replacement were received with no response. Product is simply not durable and does not last.
customer_reviews.author: lavamom

customer_reviews.title: Good heater, apparently a bad thermostat?
customer_reviews.text: I like the heater, easy to install and set up. Not thrilled the thermostat seems to have gone out 4 weeks after the return window closed, purchased early October. Woke up today to a clicking noise coming from the unit and the heating light flickering. Tank is not where it should be. Prior though, tank was at the desired temp, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ro

customer_reviews.title: Fish soup
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine gave me her fish tank before she moved away. 5 years later she moved back but died of cancer shortly afterwards at 33yo. I loved those fish as a memory of her. About 18 months after adding the heater, it malfunctioned and boiled the fish. That made me sad. If you don’t want to be sad one day, you probably shouldn’t buy this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Victor J Grazina

customer_reviews.title: Great heater but fitment is strange
customer_reviews.text: The heater has run for about a year now on my 75 gallon with no problems. That said I have a Hydor pro 600 canister filter which seems like it would be a perfect fit for this heater. This is a mistake, the heater uses a smaller connection than the 600 model of filter and as such I had to rig up a set of plumbing figments to mount them together.
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: If it leaks....your in trouble
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a good addition to my canister filter set up on my 75 gallon. I installed it and water sprayed out of the cracked plastic housing. It was a pretty big mess. I will state the box was damaged and this may have not been a factory defect. It stillay be a great heater, but I decided it's not worth the possibility of an external leak, it would have leaked all 75 gallons in a few hours. Elecrical cords everywhere. If I would not have had a "drip loop" in the cord it would have ran straight into the electrical socket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Watson

customer_reviews.title: This works very well
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery about using a heater which hangs vertically on the input line to my tank. Gravity, you know? This works very well, maybe off a smidgen, but the fish don't notice.
customer_reviews.author: David Snyder

customer_reviews.title: No heater in the tank.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that I don't have a heater in the tank. I have live plants and want as little equipment as possible in the tank. I use 2 external filters. So I have a heater on each filter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  from Syracuse

customer_reviews.title: It's been brilliant until...
customer_reviews.text: Have used it with a separate controller (purchased just to protect the aquarium from this heater based on reviews) and it worked great. Yes, it's clumsy and bulky is demanding on positioning, but it did free up the aquarium and has kept it warm. For a fantastic 5 months, after which it just stopped heating... Good think the controller has warned me up and I could put another heater in. Paying this price for a think that can't last even a year (with all the right maintenance) - nah, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: kroman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canister Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through five other internal heaters with mixed results for my 10, 20, and 50 gallon freshwater tanks. This was the first heater that worked consistently and quickly. Adjusting the temperature and reaching the desired level was very easy. Just note that you a canister filter for this item. Incidentt, my favorite aspect is that I do not have to take up space in the tank or display and ugly heater. Very nice Hydor. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: This is item is a great product that’s easily purchased through amazon and is intended to be convenient to keep your tank clutter free. This product was great until a month in it started flickering and the temperature kept dropping, I cleaned it, unplugged it but the sensor still kept flickering. The heater barely kept its temp and having just decked out my tank, this malfunction was inconvenient since i had to replace the hose I had to cut and go back to a regular heater in the tank for less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: I like it, very consistent temperature.
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my hydor canister filter. One thing I didn't know is it goes on the intake pipe. I thought it would only work on the out tube. My thermometer reads it a few degrees under what I set the heater on. I have the heater on 82 but it stays at a consistent 79.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars but overall an awesome heater. Why 2 stars then? It only lasted a month then completely died my tank dropped to 60 degrees and my fish weren’t happy. Lucky me I had my old in tank heater. But like I said while it works it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Killed $200 worth of fish
customer_reviews.text: Owned this for a few months. It just killed $200 worth on fish. Bought as used from Amazon. I thought it would be reliable since they were re selling it. Incredibly disappointed. That tank was 3 years in the making.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great I have it heating my 125 gallon tank with ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great I have it heating my 125 gallon tank with no problem. (I also have a backup heater in the sump) the reason why I take off two stars is because the tempeture dial will move when you cleaning of feeding your fish. I replaced my old hydro heater after it got stuck at 90 and almost killed all my fish. I would pay more for a digital model.
customer_reviews.author: Amado

customer_reviews.title: Looks Used, The Package was all messedup
customer_reviews.text: I just received the heater today. It looks like it was definitely used. There is dust all over the heater and the package was smushed. Why you would put that kind of package in an envelope instead of a box, I am not too sure. I will test out the heater to make sure it works and update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after few hours!
customer_reviews.text: I have added the heater to my almost 2 yeara running system. Next day i came to check on my tank. I found all my fishes (15 tiger barbs) all dead! I was shocked. It turned out that the heater was heating all night without stopping! The water tempreture was 40C (104F) i had it set to 78F. I turned the heater off. And tried to rotate the tempreture knob but it was stuck on 78F and i can not move it at all. I had to throw the heater away.
customer_reviews.author: Jasem Almeer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite heater ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these heaters in my 75 gallon tank for two or three years now with no problems. The heat has remained a constant 82, and it's nice to have one less piece of hardware to look at in the tank. I recently bought a second, intending to use two for my 150 gallon tank. Out of curiosity, I tried turning just one of the heaters on. I have since been using just one of these to heat a 150 gallon tank for the entire winter! I have 800 gallons of aquarium, and this is my favorite heater that I've used.
customer_reviews.author: John Roads

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product is a complete waste of electricity. Does not work well maintaining temps for 75 gallon tank even though its rated for bigger tanks. Its useless and couldn't maintain a fish bowl. I purchased it because the glass heaters kept cracking and damn near electrocuting me so I figured an inline would be better. WRONG. Better at wasting money yes...at working properly...no! Get something better.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Nice to remove equipment from my tank
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a little pricier than normal aquarium heaters, but it is definitely worth it. The whole point of an aquarium is to have something beautiful to look at, so the more equipment that you can hide away and not have sitting in your face collecting algae the better. It keeps my 75G aquarium at a very steady 78oF and I haven't had any problems during the few months that I have owned it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin T. Busiek

customer_reviews.title: First one correct plug, 2nd ik plug.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 2 of these from the same seller now, first one came with US plug went in great. 2nd arrived with UK plug and had it hooked up before realizing so had to purchase an adapter. Make sure you check it over before putting it inline can no longer return after water has been though it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Cushman

customer_reviews.title: Superb heater
customer_reviews.text: i bought two of these for 2 new setups and both have been working flawlessly for over a month now. Temps have been dead on. Hopefully they last for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marth

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in May 2019, went to change the filter pad in my external filter and the heater completely STOPPED WORKING AFTER ONE MONTH. Ridiculous. For all I know, this could have stopped working after 1 week, because I haven't checked it for a couple weeks since I bought it. I thought this was a good product but not anymore. Be hesitant about buying this product. Calling customer service now.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Owned since February 2, 2012
customer_reviews.text: Plumbed it on the exhaust of my caniste filter for a 57 gallon tank. It keeps the water temp rock steady and no uuuugly heater to hide... I wish more manufacturers would make these. Update: owned this since February 2, 2012. No problems, no leaks, reliably held the temperature of the tank steady, without leaking or acting buggy. No eye sore in the tank either :) I have it plumbed on the output of my Fluval 406 which also has an atomic CO2 diffuser. This way you see nothing in the planted tank and the filter delivers clean, warm, CO2 rich water!
customer_reviews.author: Sundragon

customer_reviews.title: This is the best heater I have used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best heater I have used. Just bought a new one for a new tank, but have one running for 3 years plus without ever touching the dial. I put 200 watt on a 55 gallon and it does the job perfectly I also put 200w on a 30g and it turns on and off more often than the bigger tank but still keeps perfect temp. Its great having the heater outside of the tank/outside of view. Frank
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hinojos

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best heater I ever had, keeps the water at the right temperature. Just set it and forget it, yes I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn't at all
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for 2 weeks, then the relay kept clicking on and off repeatedly several times a minute for hours. Looked up advice from the manufacturer, cleaned the heater and turned the set temperature down several degrees. This worked and the heater was back to normal for another week until today when the tank temperature was down 10 degrees and the heater wasn't even trying to do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryu Cipris

customer_reviews.title: Buying thru Amazon voids warranty
customer_reviews.text: my heater lasted less than 3 months, since the warranty is only honored if the seller mails in the completed warranty card and ships the heater back to the manufacturer, I find myself with no way to use the warranty. I suggest you avoid buying this product thru amazon
customer_reviews.author: S.Travis

customer_reviews.title: Enough power(30 gallon tank)  and fairly accurate
customer_reviews.text: I find the thermostat to be pretty accurate, and it's got enough power for my 30 gallon tank to never have to be on for more than half an hour continuously. I run in in line after my canister filter's output. I've read complaints from others that the thermostat isn't accurate enough, but that can be EASILY fixed by adding a more expensive thermostat controller.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within a year, happy I keep an eye on my tank temperature.
customer_reviews.text: Of course, it lasted for the warrantied time but I have tried to work through Amazon who couldn't do anything for my other than get me in contact with the Hydor company. I sent an email explaining that the unit is dead and have never received word back. I had to return to a submersible heater which I don't like as much but it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to install, but after the first one the rest were much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Lili Breck

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! No leaks, holds temp well and has a red light that switches on/off automatically letting you know its regulating the temp.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H.

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad to have the old style heater out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Have this in the turtle tank for the last few weeks and it's keeping the water at exactly the correct temp. I'm glad to have the old style heater out of the tank - the turtles are rough on them and I was lucky to get a year out of a heater before it would be broken. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good while it worked.
customer_reviews.text: It was a great product and I would have given it 5 stars but it stopped working way to quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Hack Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: First in line heater but I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine used, still works great the heater is still accurate and the auto shutoff works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Riske

customer_reviews.title: Died in 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Died in 3 weeks. If my tank wasn’t still in its fishless cycle I’d be royally pissed
customer_reviews.author: BrokeintheOC

customer_reviews.title: I have had 2 fail now
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these items I bought failed within 2 weeks of installation. The second lasted a couple of months and now won't even turn on. I have kept fish tanks for years and I know what I'm doing...while this concept is a great one this product is terribly made and I would suggest you avoid purchasing one at all costs. Deal with the tried and true hang on glass heaters because at least they last longer than the lifespan of even the shortest lived fish. Seriously, do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Lacking quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: For how much this cost I expected a little better quality. Not even 6 months into using it, it didn’t turn on one time and dropped the temp in my tank to 55 degrees F. Killed the fish. When it was working it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: Used for 4 years without issue. Ordered a temperature controller outlet as backup in case something ever triggered it to stay on, and readings stay consistent at 78 it is set at. My controller gives me piece of mind that it will trigger at 81 (emergency), but has never been needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Cook

customer_reviews.title: These heaters don't last very long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the 300 watt heaters. Neither lasted more than a few months. Don't put your fish in danger with these poorly designed heaters.
customer_reviews.author: CGM

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped Working after 2 months. Left town and came back to a dead heater and a 74 degree aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anson

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to the traditional aquarium heater!
customer_reviews.text: Hydor's ETH 300 In-Line External heater is a great alternative to the traditional aquarium heater. This device does a reliable job of maintaining your tank's water temperature without taking up space or being an eye sore inside the tank. I have this heater connected to the return line of the Rena FilStar XP3 canister filter in my 55-gallon freshwater tank. The heater has been working reliably for over a year, and I am very satisfied with it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worked in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: The heater worked great in the beginning, but less than one year later, it is no longer heating my planted fish tank water.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Park

customer_reviews.title: Keeps temp in tank
customer_reviews.text: Connected it to my Penn Plax Cascade Canister Filter 1000. Works like a champ, keeps my 60gal tank at the right temperature all the time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: While the cost of this is about 2 to 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: While the cost of this is about 2 to 3 times the cost of a comparable submersible heater, I went for this as it eliminates the need for one to see an unsightly heater in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: gfrontosa

customer_reviews.title: Leaking...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 4 months and then began to leak
customer_reviews.author: S. Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: I had to do some finaggling but I finally got it to work with my Fluval canister filter. I had to get some smooth tubing as it leaked with the ribbed tubing the comes with the Fluval filter. Worth the money, very efficient way to heat the water for a larger aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: lynettieo

customer_reviews.title: I liked it so much that I bought another one
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hydor In-Line Heater. The first one is still working on another tank. I liked it so much that I bought another one. This has been running for 3 months now and loving it. I never have to worry about it overheating during a water change. While most in-tank heaters have a safety shut off when the water levels get too low, I have found that some don't always automatically turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Tarntongjaroen

customer_reviews.title: 10 month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Unit did not last a year sadly, it no longer heats my aquarium. Now I'm torn on whether I should get another or go with a standard in-tank heater. Bummer because it did look so nice.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Best inline heater that I have owned. Had to buy some extra pieces to adapt down to a smaller line, but everything works and no leaks. Very accurate as I check with my digital thermometer and it was within 1/10 of a degree.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: This heater keeps our tank at exactly the temperature we want. Very consistent. We were concerned about an in line heater, but not anymore. We use it on our 60 gallon and it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: shihtzumom

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 12 months
customer_reviews.text: All of a sudden stopped working as of today:( Nice product, when it works. Hydor.com seems to be down at the moment, I will try to figure out if there is a warranty coverage.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Got this in may 2020. Worked great, until one day it didn't any more. Not sure exactly when it quit working but I've only had it 3 or 4 months max..
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Beard

customer_reviews.title: Was working fine but after 1 month it suddenly stopped functioning
customer_reviews.text: Was working fine but after 1 month it suddenly stopped functioning. Thought this was a neat heater but its just a waste of money. Back to internal heaters for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vu

customer_reviews.title: great for 125G
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 125G I have it set to 77, I thought I would take too much effort to heat the water, and it is working great! My AC is usually set to 70-75 and my tank is right under a air vent and I have no issues, I hardly see it on.
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It worked well. I could put this out of the way to give my planted tank a clean look. However, a few things to consider: 1. It has to be run vertically. One side has to be the up side. You might find yourself running out of hose or space. 2. I connected it to my Fluval 306/406. You have to either use a rubber adapter that Fluval sells or really clamp it with tightener or tape. Otherwise, it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Go Go

customer_reviews.title: Makes the case for canister filters
customer_reviews.text: The 300 Watt model keeps a rock-steady 76° temperature on my 75 gallon aquarium. This thing alone makes the case for a canister filter. Love being rid of internal heaters that are impossible to both conceal and place optimally.
customer_reviews.author: Aerocraft67

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 11 months.
customer_reviews.text: My first one was dead on arrival. I figured I got a lemon and exchanged for another one. This one worked well. I had followed the advice given in the other reviews and used an external thermostat. Today after 11 months, I see that my aquarium is down to 71F. The heater must have died over night. Fortunately I caught it early and was able to use an older submersible heater to get the fish back to their 75F.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Had it about a week and it keeps accurate temp according to my digital thermometer. It gives my tank a cleaner look while increasing water volume. I was able to stretch my half inch hose from my eheim 2213 to fit the 5/8 ends by heating it with a heat gun. I do sometimes hear an audible click when it switches on and off. It is slightly louder than my previous in tank heater. This one is not in an enclosed space. It isn't loud enough to bother me or I would try wrapping it with some insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Five years is pretty good but not great for a higher end heater
customer_reviews.text: Lasted until September of 2015. Bought in June of 2010. Thermostat failed not heating element. Five years is pretty good but not great for a higher end heater. I think there is little competition in this class of heater so ordering a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: Heater worked great for three weeks. No leaks and held a steady temp at 76 without any issues. Until one night three weeks later it started clicking on and off rapidly and couldn’t even hold 70 degrees in the tank. Didn’t even last a month. Requested an exchange so we’ll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Poor product description
customer_reviews.text: I wish this product description had the dimensions of the actual product rather than the box.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Only last about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked which was only about 6 months. Would not recommend and will not repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: This is a great heater, out of sight out of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for two years, works great. No issues. Actually rarely even look at it. 55 gallon tank freshwater planted aquarium and the 200w works just fine. I have the tank in my family room and I can hear it click on every once in awhile, but in no way is the noise annoying or distracting. Really like that it gets a heater out of the aquarium for a more natural look.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen D.

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: A great product! I installed this with an external canister filter for a divided 20 gal long multi betta tank. No more hot and cold spots and no more multiple mini heaters, giving the fish more room. As with too many products, the directions for installation weren't that clear but I got it figured out.
customer_reviews.author: petlovermom1964

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 3, 1 broke after a couple of months...
customer_reviews.text: 2 of 3 remained running for over a year now
customer_reviews.author: ForCommenting

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a few days
customer_reviews.text: Died after just a few days. I tried to unplug it and see if it would reset..no luck. When it worked it was great. I have returned it and ordered a replacement to give it one more try. I put my in tank heater back in for now. (glad I had one!) I might even leave it in set to a lower temp to serve as a backup until I feel confident with the ETH 200 Update....2nd one died after a few months and now I can't return it....had high hopes, but will not be getting another. STAY AWAY if you care for your fish!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: So far this is the best heater i have bought
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best heater i have bought! it keeps the temp right on spot and it does not drop much at all!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Pedraza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Queens needs
customer_reviews.text: In line, keeps intank equipment to a minimum. Alligators tend to chew on and destroy stuff. Easy to use. Keeps accurate temp. When "The Queen" out grows this home will easily handle her new 300 gallon enclosure.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J.

customer_reviews.title: Concerned due to previous reviews!!
customer_reviews.text: Item works perfectly fine! Although I have concerns of the overheating, I had to purchase a additional Hydor external thermostat (an additional $60) to add an additional layer of protection to my turtle tank. It's nice to have the heater outside the tank! I'm giving it four stars due to the fact that I had to buy an external thermostat just to protect my turtle. All my concerns came from all the previous reviews, thank you everyone for all the help.
customer_reviews.author: Albert T

customer_reviews.title: Works great with canisters.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get your heater out of your tank. Works great with canisters. Heats the tank well.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M.

customer_reviews.title: worked!
customer_reviews.text: Get the job done! and my tank looks much cleaner without the heater inside.
customer_reviews.author: Aqualexs

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even work for 24 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Heater didn't even work for 24 hours. Failed to turn off. Heated the tank to over 90 degrees. I'm lucky I was doing a fishless cycle. Will be returning this heater for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Larkin

product_meta.title: Hydor In-Line External Heater - Original ETH
product_meta.description: Size:300 Watt 5/8"ETH Heaters are the first external heaters for aquariums with the exclusive PTC technology. The self-limiting PTC heating element guarantees maximum safety against any risk of overheating. Designed to be used on return lines coming from canister filters or sumps.
feature_bullets: Suitable for marine and tropical aquariums

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
